result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andy J. Gerow

records.addlTxt: Plea date on December 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:43 p.m.  Inducement:  MD plea disposition, $150.00 fine/costs each count.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
Plea date is set for 10/20/22, 9:00 a.m., Br. 3. 
Minutes.
Plea date scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea date on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Judge Dewane from Attorney Norby.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Competency hearing on July 25, 2022 at 12:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andy J. Gerow appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph M Norby appeared by video for Andy J. Gerow. 
The Court received competency report which was filed in the defendant's Dodge County case where he was found to be not competent.  
Attorney Norby is concerned that unless this Court also finds the defendant incompetent to proceed, the defendant will have issues being accepted into the treatment facility.
Court adjourns this matter for all parties to review the Dodge Co report and for counsel to look further into what the facility requires as far as all of the pending cases he has across various counties.  
Competency review set for 07-25-2022 at 12:00pm via Zoom.
Report of Thomas Speech, Ph.D. (originally filed in 22 CF 307).
Letter from Judge Dewane to Judge Pfitzinger requesting copy of competency report from Dodge County case.

2:34 pm -  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andy J. Gerow appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Joseph M Norby appeared by video for Andy J. Gerow.  Attorney Norby raises competency in this matter.  Defendant was recently found incompetent in a pending case in Dodge County, 22 CF 53.  He will be entering into treatment.  The Court suspends these proceedings and requests a copy of the competency evaluation from Dodge County be filed in this case.  After reviewing that, if the Court determined another evaluation is needed, he will order it.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  Bail furnsished.
Status conference is set for 07-05-22 at 4:15 p.m.
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 117689,
Payable Number: 156286,
Receipt Number: 22R 007664,
Amount: $20.00
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 04-06-22.  
Initial appearance is set for 06-06-22 at 1:30 p.m.
